lines.text: Old Rock of Ages, we've got ourselves another war. A gut bustin', mother-lovin' Navy war.
All battles are fought by scared men who'd rather be someplace else.
Does that include admirals?
Yes.
It is my duty to inform you that you have been relieved of your command, pending the findings of a court of inquiry.
I don't understand, sir.
You weren't zig-zagging when you took the two torpedoes.
I was stretching my fuel, sir.
If you didn't have fuel to complete your mission, why didn't you turn back for Pearl?
that my group was expendable.

I doubt if a court of inquiry will accept that. Captain, you're about to be caught in a vacuum between a peacetime Navy and a wartime Navy. Six months from now, they'll be making admirals out of captains who exhibit some guts. But right now, they're only reacting to the Pearl Harbor disaster, and punishment is order-of-the-day. Of course, you don't have to abide by what a court of inquiry decides. You can ask for general court-martial, get yourself a couple of crack sea lawyers, and make a fight of it.
I wouldn't care to do that, sir.
Why not?
Second-generation Navy, Admiral.
I see. I don't plan to ask for court-martial either, Captain, and I've lost a fleet. So I expect we'll both just take what they give us, and trust it will be a useful job somewhere.
Yes, sir.
Good luck.
Good luck to you, sir.
A fast ship going in harm's way - a lousy situation, Commander Eddington.
Lousy!
[the Cassiday is underway, trying to escape the attack on Pearl Harbor]
Captain Harding, sir, and the exec!

[Standing on the bow of a pursuing motor whaleboat, frantically waving his hat up and down]
Cassiday! Stop! Let us aboard!
How the hell can we stop? It'll take twenty minutes at this speed!

[Making a decision not to stop]
Does anyone on this bridge see anything back there?
Well, if they do, Mr. McConnell, I'll guarantee you they won't see nothin' again.
lines.character: Bosun's Mate Chief Culpepper, USS Cassiday

lines.text:
[Laughing]
Let 'er rip, Mac!
I made a special effort to not look like a nurse.
Leaving, sir?
Yes. Before I pick you up and throw you to the fish.
Well, we all know the Navy's never wrong. But in this case, it was a little weak on bein' right.
On the most exalted throne in the world, we are seated on nothing but our own arse.
How do admirals feel about nurses?
The same way captains did.
I'm so scared, my bones are clicking. Like dice, on a Reno craps table.
Sir, I can't put up all of my men unless we get at least five more transports.
Well, aren't there any more R4D's on Tulabonne?
Yes, but they're held in reserve.
Reserve! What... for?
That's the way Admiral Broderick has things organized.
What happens if an R4D conks out?
Tulabonne sends us a spare until we get it fixed.
Five of 'em just conked out, Gregg.
Let's relay the sad news to Broderick!
Mr. Canfil, you seem to have fallen in among thieves!
It does seem so, Admiral, I'm very happy to say!
Bums like your friend Owynn are with us always, like bad weather. But sailors like your old man only happen once in a while
I'm afraid I cannot accept your evaluation of Commander Owynn.
Well , I'm afraid I cannot accept you as Rock Torrey's son. I think somebody got in there ahead of him.
Now wait a minute, Eddington!
*Captain* Eddington. Yes?
Gottlieb! Tuthill!
[as Gottlieb and Tuthill leave the washroom, Powell takes out a quarter, tosses it, and covers it on his arm]
Heads.

[uncovers the quarter and inspects it, laughing]
Good-bye, Commander! Enjoy it!
[Exit]
Now what do you suppose he meant by that?
Well, aren't you going with Broderick?
Why, no, I...
I think you are.
Now wait a m...

[slaps Owynne backhanded]
Now I don't care how you do it, but you'd better be on that plane with Broderick - unless you want to be buried on the island of Gavabutu.
You can't do that to m...

[forehand slap]
I *am* doing it. We've got a job here, and neither you nor Broderick nor anybody else is going to screw it up. Understand?
[Another forehand slap]
Hmm? And take this punk with you.
[Exit]
I'll have him court-martialled - striking a fellow officer. And you saw it! I didn't hit him back.
[looks at his cut lip in a hand mirror]
I didn't see anything!
What do you mean, you didn't see anything?
As far as I'm concerned, a coconut fell through the roof and hit you in the mouth. So you better figure out some excuse to get us on that plane with Broderick.
How'd you like to be transferred back to PT Boats, fella? 'Cause one word from me to Broderick and you're on your way!
Say the word!
[exit, leaving Owynne to look at his cut lip again]
[the Cassiday has just sunk the Japanese sub that torpedoed Torrey's cruiser]
Nice work, Harding! You did a 4-0 job on that sub!
Thank you, sir, I'm not Commander Harding, sir.
Well, where is he?
Ashore, sir!
Well, who's in command?
I am, sir! Lt. j.g. McConnell, sir!
Did I hear Lieutenant junior grade?
William McConnell; Class of '38, sir!
Oh. Well, can you rig for towing?
Can do, sir!
Can you pass some portable pumps to us?
Can do, sir!
Carry on, Mister!

[Quietly, to himself, with admiration]
Can do.
You're a hard man to kill, aren't you, Admiral?
Now, Grant didn't give a damn about organization, but neither was he afflicted with the virus. Admiral Torrey, you're going to be my Grant!
Oh, he had his chances to ask me. Ten days' worth of chances, that's enough. He didn't call me, so I called him.
How did you have the nerve?

Annalee dear, past a certain age, men are apt to avoid making sudden moves where women are concerned. The women have to do the sudden moving, or else everybody stands still until it's too late. It gets late fast in these times. I like this man, and I want him to know it - now.
Suppose he and Jere bump into each other? Jere's very funny about his father.
Oh, let 'em bump. I'd be interested to see what happens.

[the Cassidy prepares to head out]
Mac, we've got to wait for the Captain
Screw the Captain.
There once was a lady from Niger. Who smiled as she rode on a tiger. They came back from the ride With the lady inside. And the smile on the face of the tiger.
Hey, that's quite a knife you carry.
Yeah. Can opener, screwdriver, punch, straight blade - even a skinning blade.
Oh, that is useful. What do you skin?
Lieutenant nurses who pull my leg.
In case it slipped your mind, it's gunnery stations at 0830.
We both know what's eating you, Paul. You can't wash it out with booze.
Paul, you're forcing me to throw my weight at you. Fish, or cut bait. Get on your feet or take your troubles elsewhere. I've got a ship to run.
If you can hold a razor in that hand, you might shave before you come topside.
Aye, aye, Father Torrey.
Let's crawl back into a uniform. You make us look like a bunch of pirates.
What is Vicki Marlowe's secret?

Well, it's not what it says in here. Vicki Marlowe's secret is that she's making a half a million bucks a year and she still collects alimony from me, in my present reduced circumstances. Well, anyway... I have the satisfaction of knowing that all of her pictures have been stinkers since I stopped writing them. Rockwell, my boy, never, I repeat never marry a movie actress.
You married three of them.
I know. It was like eating peanuts. Once I started, I couldn't stop.
Well, us civilians need more rest and recreation than you Old Salts.
It's about time you crawled down from Mount Rushmore and took a look around for yourself. You'd be surprised at the changes we've made in the last 100 years.
Man, I tell you, the women - they're smokin' cigarettes, drinkin' whiskey, doin' the shimmy-sham-shimmy, hot damn!
Well, I'm... flying under... false colors, Miss Haynes. I don't know my son. I've been divorced for many years and he's been raised by his mother and family. I didn't even know he was in the Navy.
He needs a zipper in his face.
He's my son.
Well! I'd like to meet him, Rock.
No you wouldn't.
Well, I'm here to see a nurse. What are you here for?
To see a nurse.
It looks like we have something in common after all.
I'm just a chip off the old block, sir!
You run a taut ship.
He's not a bad looking kid, is he?
Ever hear the name 'Cunliffe'?
It's one of those expensive New England names, isn't it?
Well, we gave him the molasses. Now let's feed him the sulfur.
Torrey, you just named your own poison.
I can't fire him. I can't scramble his whole command over night. It leaves a bad effect on our allies and gives aid and comfort to the enemy.
Indecision is a virus that can run through an army and destroy it's will to win. Or even to survive.
Just how far can I go in dealing with Admiral Broderick, sir?
Well. Ya can't kill 'im.
Egan, you just don't understand the love affairs between ships and sailors.
Captain Burke, you have just anchored on poverty row!
Get a message off to Pearl. "Have taken two torpedoes." Fill in our position. "Extent of damage unknown. Will advise."
And break radio silence, sir?
Burke, don't you think the Japanese know by now where we are?
Mister McConnell, no tellin' when we might ship together again, and, well, me and the boys all took a vote, and we voted you the best officer to be marooned on a desert island with!
lines.character: Bosun's Mate Chief Culpepper, USS Cassiday

lines.text: [Torrey is receiving a damage control report after being torpedoed]
Full report.

Well, we've halted the fires up forward where we took the first torpedo, sir, and we've stopped the flow of water at Hatch 26. Commander Eddington says to tell the Old Man that - I'm sorry, sir, the Captain, sir - that he'd better start thinking about a tow. May I also say, sir, that Commander Eddington is hell on wheels, sir.
[Powell has just discovered that Eddington has flown off on a suicide mission]
You mean you just gave him a plane without checking with Operations?
Sir, Captain Eddington is Chief of Staff; sir, he *is* Operations.

There's a way to find out what the Japs are up to; but I'll have to do it myself. I used to run a plantation on Gavabutu; I know that island like the back of my hand. Have one of your subs put me ashore there and in two weeks, I'll be able to tell you just what our little yellow brothers are up to.
All right, Mr. Canfil; but be careful, we can't afford to lose you.

[Grinning]
I'm not planning on getting lost, Admiral.
Skipper, if I let you down, will you please shoot me?
Sure.

[after identifying the Yamato]
When this baby comes your way, look out!

[as Eddington takes off on his recon flight]
Sir! How shall I log this flight?
Joy ride with the Chief of Staff!

[searching the skies with a hand over his eyes; spots the first six planes]
My God, they're Japs.
lines.character: U.S. Army Air Corps Major, Liz Eddington's Lover

lines.text: What?
They're Japs... MY GOD, THEY'RE JAPS!
lines.character: U.S. Army Air Corps Major, Liz Eddington's Lover

lines.text: [Exeunt, hastily, getting strafed all the way]
